# Acurast Documentation

> Complete reference documentation for Acurast

This file contains links to documentation sections following the llmstxt.org standard.

- [Overview](https://docs.acurast.com/docs/staked-compute/overview): Acurast is building a decentralized compute network where anyone can contribute processing power using smartphones. To ensure this network stays re...
- [Slashing](https://docs.acurast.com/docs/staked-compute/slashing): Slashing is a penalty mechanism designed to ensure committers keep their promise of providing consistent compute power over time. If a committer fa...
- [Staking FAQ](https://docs.acurast.com/docs/staked-compute/staking-faq): You must unstake and wait for the cooldown to end, before you can migrate to mainnet or transfer processors to a different account. As the cooldown...
- [Staking Glossary](https://docs.acurast.com/docs/staked-compute/staking-glossary): Redelegation can only be done if the current delegation is older than 7 days or if the stake of the chosen Committer is in cooldown.
